result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeromy Scott Vandyke

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jeromy Scott Vandyke
Current: 1715 1/2 S Jefferson St, Appleton, WI 54915 United States  (Effective: 05-20-2016)
Prior: 121 GolfCourt Dr, Wrightstown, WI 54180 United States

14CF195, 15CF14, 14TR2216, 14TR2217, 14TR2218, 14TR2219, 15TR212 & 15TR213 cases called at 2:45 pm. Defendant Jeromy Scott Vandyke in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record by DA Blader. Defendant and Attorney Szilagyi concur with reading. State withdraws the motion to forfeit bond. Amended Information addressed. Confirm receipt, waive formal reading. Entry of plea to Counts 1 & 3.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1 & 3 of 15CF14.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 of 15CF14 and dismisses and reads-in 14CF195, 14TR2216, 14TR2217, 14TR2218, 14TR2219, 15TR212 & 15TR213. Statement by defendant.  Court sentences the defendant to: COUNT 1- 10 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time credit. Credit for 45 days served. To commence immediately. $2388.50 fine inclusive of costs + $42.50 blood draw costs, bond is to be applied.  33 month DL revocation, 33 month IID, OWI Assessment. COUNT 3- 10 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Concurrent to Count 1. 45 days credit.  Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Bond to be applied. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-05-2015 02:15 pm

14CF195 & 15CF14 Cases called @ 2:46 p.m. Defendant Jeromy Scott Vandyke in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Szilagyi requesting another plea/sentencing date as the defendant has moved and needs to make arrangements in the county is which he currently resides.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

14CF-195 and and 15CF-14 - Both Cases Called @ 3:41 PM: Defendant Jeromy Scott Vandyke in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  INFO Stated - Counsel admit receipt - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.  15CF-14:   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.   ARGN to proceed.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  State reserves the right to amend INFO on Tox Report is received.  NGP received and entered.  STC Scheduled as to all matters - NOH Given.  State's motion to forfeit bond is tabled and track along with pending matters.
Motion hearing on February 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
State's Motion to Forfeit Bond
Arraignment on February 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Arraignment on February 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

11:30 am case called Defendant Jeromy Scott Vandyke in court with attorney Angela Wang.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over matter on calendar for today. Attorney Wang states defendant wishes to waive the preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant regarding waiver. Defendant confirms waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint and finds probable cause a felony has been committed within the courts jurisdiction and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Attorney Wang requests arraignment be held in Februrary. Court grants.  Arraignment scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
State's
Bail/Bond Review on December 19, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail
Preliminary hearing on December 19, 2014 at 11:30 am.

2:22 pm case called. Defendant Jeromy Scott Vandyke in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing and time limits discussed. Bond modification request by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by ADA Anderson. Court denies request for modification of bond. Defendant wishes to have preliminary hearing within 10 days. PH Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Defendant's
Initial appearance on December 10, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:03 p.m. Defendant Jeromy Scott Vandyke in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. ADA Anderson requesting $500 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting sig bond or lower cash bond. Court orders $1000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
